node.title: Quarantine rules in Queensland are about to change, here's what you need to know
node.alt: a person wearing gloves holding a syringe
node.description: From New Year's Day, fully vaccinated close contacts of COVID cases will be subject to less stringent quarantine requirements. It's to help keep the economy going when cases begin to surge. Here's what you need to know.
node.content:
["From New Year's Day, Queenslanders identified as close contacts of COVID-19 cases will be subject to less stringent quarantine\u00a0requirements.", "Queensland's Health Minister\u00a0Yvette D'Ath outlined the new rules\u00a0yesterday.", "Ms D'Ath said\u00a0Queenslanders would\u00a0learn to live with the virus\u00a0when the state reopened\u00a0its border to hotspots from\u00a0Monday.", "But are Queenslanders ready for what is coming?", "To help the economy cope with inevitable outbreaks, Queensland has introduced new quarantine measures for vaccinated people.", "
What will change\u00a0for close contacts?
", "Previously all close contacts were required to immediately get tested for COVID-19, contact Queensland Health and isolate for 14 days,\u00a0even if they had tested negative.", "However, under the new rules, close contacts will move out of quarantine on day eight\u00a0\u2014\u00a0if they have tested negative on days one and\u00a0five of the isolation period.", "Queensland Health has also advised that close contacts should wear masks for the rest of the 14-day period and that they should avoid high-risk facilities\u00a0such as\u00a0hospitals, aged-care homes and prisons.", "The changes will come into effect on January 1, 2022,\u00a0but will\u00a0only apply if the person is\u00a0vaccinated.", "
How about if you share a house with a close contact?
", "Since the pandemic began, secondary contacts \u2014 people living with someone who has been identified as a close contact \u2013 have been required also to get tested and quarantine for 14 days.", "But, from January 1, vaccinated secondary contacts will not need to quarantine at all.", "They will, however, need to get a test on days one and five after their close contact is identified.", "However,\u00a0if you are unvaccinated and a household contact and you're not able to separate from that contact in a household, you will need to do the same seven-day quarantine\u00a0period and comply with the same requirements for\u00a0days eight to 14.", "For unvaccinated close contacts, the rules remain the same from January 1:\u00a0You will need to quarantine for 14 days, immediately get tested and, then again, on days five and 12.", "
Has anything changed for casual contacts?
", "Casual contacts still need to get tested once their connection to a case has been identified, and they will be required to quarantine until they get a negative result.", "They are also encouraged to wear a mask outside the home for the next fortnight.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
